page.title: 03Farming in Horton
page.content:
There were once 22 farms in this area but now there are only eight. All use family labour and casual workers when necessary. This has meant a great reduction in the number of farm workers. New asbestos buildings are gradually replacing the traditional stone barns to meet the needs of modern methods. Heavy farm work is done by tractors, each farm having two or three. Other machinery includes loading forks, mowers, balers, slurry and muck spreaders. Land-rovers and trailers are used to transport animals to and from market. Some farms use motor-bikes for shepherding.
Farmers in 1985 are often restricted by committees who see this area as a playground for visitors as this is part of the Dales National Park.
